citation.article-title: Proposal of Cobetia marina gen. nov., comb. nov., within the family Halomonadaceae, to include the species Halomonas marina.

p.s: Cobetia (Co.be.tia, Cobet, scientist that described originally this organism as Arthrobacter marinus)
Gram negative, straight, rod-shaped cells that are 1.6–4.0 by 0.8–1.2 μm, and occur singly and in pairs.
Most strains are motile by means of two to five peritrichous flagella.
Colonies are round, bright, smooth and cream pigmented.
Aerobic; unable to grow anaerobically in the presence of nitrate or arginine.
Optimal growth occurs in the presence of 5% (wt/vol) salts.
Good growth is also obtained at 0.5% and up to 20% but not at 0 or 25% (wt/vol) salts.
Hydrolyses casein, DNA and tyrosine, but not aesculin, gelatine, starch or Tween 80.
Simmons citrate, urease and ONPG positive.
Negative to phenylalanine deaminase, methyl red, indole production and nitrate reduction.
Acid is produced from glucose and other sugars.
As long as this genus contains one single species its description is coincident with that of the species, which is also the type species.
